title: [BUG] server/js/build folder missing
body:
Thank you for submitting an issue. Please refer to our [issue policy](https://www.github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/ISSUE_POLICY.md)
for information on what types of issues we address. For help with debugging your code, please refer to [Stack Overflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/mlflow).

Please fill in this template and do not delete it unless you are sure your issue is outside its scope.

### System information
- **Have I written custom code (as opposed to using a stock example script provided in MLflow)**: No
- **OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04)**: Mac
- **MLflow installed from (source or binary)**: source
- **MLflow version (run ``mlflow --version``)**: 1.2.1.dev0
- **Python version**: 3.6.9
- **npm version, if running the dev UI**: 6.9.0
- **Exact command to reproduce**: mlflow server

### Describe the problem
browser shows:
"The requested URL was not found on the server. If you entered the URL manually please check your spelling and try again."


This issue has been reported many times in the past. In my case, this error occurs when I install mlflow from source code, but it works if mlflow is installed from pip install. After I investigated the issue, I found that the code uses `server/js/build` as the static folder, which is a valid path in the pip version, but missing from the source code. 

Can someone help me understand whether this is a bug, why the `server/js/build` is missing from the source code.
